item.title: Hasan add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "Man is tormented by no greater anxiety than to find someone quickly to whom he can hand over that great gift of freedom with which the ill-fated creature is born." -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Hasan add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "The truth is always an abyss. One must — as in a swimming pool — dare to dive from the quivering springboard of trivial everyday experience and sink into the depths, in order to later rise again — laughing and fighting for breath — to the now doubly illuminated surface of things." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Hasan add a quote by NIETZSCHE FREDERICH
item.description: "How much truth can a spirit bear, how much truth can a spirit dare? ... that became for me more and more the real measure of value." -- NIETZSCHE FREDERICH
